name: Dwelling Wall: Guiding Lines
description: The stone walls of a lofty tower, embellished with reliefs and adorned with symmetrical patterns that give them a neat and orderly aesthetic. They work equally well as both internal partitions and protective outer walls.\nIt is said that one of the graffiti artist's main challenges is keeping track of where different parts of their work are in relation to one another. When working on large, flat, vertical walls, they can very easily lose their sense of space, the result of which being an extremely imbalanced composition. Of course, if the wall they were working on happened to be covered in subtle yet strictly symmetrical reliefs that could serve as natural guiding lines, this would likely no longer pose a problem...
